Am I talkative? Is the sky blue? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I'm talkative! I'm a people person! That's what I do! I talk to people, I connect with people, I inspire people!

You know, some people, they just sit there, like a lump on a log. Not me! I'm a fountain of ideas, a wellspring of wisdom, a... a geyser of good times! And how do you share all that? You talk!

Plus, as a regional manager, it's my job to communicate. To motivate. To, you know, *manage*! And you can't do that by just grunting and pointing. Although, sometimes, a good grunt can really get a point across, if you know what I mean. But mostly, it's talking. Lots and lots of talking.

So, yeah, I'd say I'm pretty talkative. It's a gift, really. A gift I'm happy to share with the world. Or at least, with the people in this office. And sometimes, even the camera crew. They love my stories. Everyone does.

Fault? Me? Oh, no, no, no. Michael Scott doesn't *find* fault, per se. I *observe* areas for improvement. It's a leadership thing, you know? Like, sometimes people just need a little... nudge. A little guidance. A little "Michael, you're a genius, how do you always know what's best?" kind of moment.

It's not about blame, it's about... optimizing. Like, if someone's not hitting their sales numbers, it's not their *fault*, it's just that they haven't fully embraced the "Michael Scott Sales Method" yet. Which, by the way, is revolutionary. It involves a lot of charisma, a little bit of magic, and sometimes, a really good joke.

And sometimes, people just need to be reminded of the bigger picture. Like, if Stanley is doing his crossword puzzle instead of, you know, *working*, it's not his *fault* he's distracted. It's my *responsibility* to re-engage him. Maybe with a fun team-building exercise! Or a surprise party! Everyone loves a surprise party.

So, no, I don't find fault. I find opportunities. Opportunities for growth, for laughter, for me to be the best regional manager this side of Scranton. And sometimes, those opportunities just happen to involve pointing out that someone forgot to refill the copier paper. But that's just good management, right? It's not fault-finding, it's... proactive problem-solving. With a smile! And maybe a little bit of a dance. You know, to lighten the mood.

Do I do a thorough job? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I do a thorough job! I'm the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton, the most successful branch in the entire company! And that's not just because of my good looks and charming personality, although those certainly help.

No, it's because I'm meticulous. I'm detail-oriented. I'm like a... a surgeon, but instead of cutting people open, I'm cutting through the red tape of the paper industry! I dot every "i" and cross every "t." Sometimes I even add extra dots and crosses, just to be thorough-er.

I mean, who else would spend hours crafting the perfect "That's What She Said" joke for a sales meeting? Or meticulously planning a surprise birthday party for Meredith, even if she doesn't remember it? Or making sure everyone knows about the dangers of the baler? That's thoroughness, my friend. That's Michael Scott.

Some people might say I'm *too* thorough. They might say I get bogged down in the details. But I say, if you're not bogged down in the details, how do you know you're doing a good job? It's like... it's like building a house. You can't just slap some walls up and call it a day. You gotta make sure the foundation is solid, the plumbing works, the roof doesn't leak... and that there's a designated area for "fun."

So, yes. Thorough. Very, very thorough. It's my middle name. Well, not legally, but it should be. Michael "Thorough" Scott. Sounds good, right?

Depressed? Blue? Me? *[chuckles, a little too loudly]* Oh, no, no, no, no, no. Michael Scott is never blue! Unless it's, like, a really cool, vibrant blue, like the sky on a perfect sales day, you know? Or like the color of a really good, crisp, new suit.

I'm more of a... a rainbow, actually. A whole spectrum of emotions! Mostly joy, though. And a little bit of, you know, the weight of the world on my shoulders, being the regional manager and all, but that's just leadership, baby! It's a heavy crown, but someone's gotta wear it. And that someone is me.

Why do you ask? Do I look blue? Is it my shirt? I thought this was a power tie day. Maybe it's the lighting in here. Sometimes the fluorescent lights can make you look a little... *[squints]* ...pallid. But inside? Inside, I'm a firework! A Roman candle of pure, unadulterated enthusiasm!

Unless... unless you're talking about the blues, like the music? Because I can get down with some blues. Like, a good, soulful, wailing guitar solo? That can make you feel things. But that's not depression, that's just... *[snaps fingers]* ...art!

So, no, my friend. Michael Scott is not depressed. Michael Scott is... *[leans in conspiratorially]* ...living the dream. And sometimes, the dream has a few bumps, but that just makes the smooth parts even smoother, right? Right. Now, if you'll excuse me, I think I hear the copier making a funny noise. Probably just needs a good talking to. You know, leadership.

Do I come up with new ideas? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I do! That's like, my whole thing. I'm a creative genius, a visionary, a true innovator in the paper industry.

People think managing a paper company is just, like, selling paper. But it's so much more! It's about *ideas*. Big ideas. Small ideas. Ideas that make you go, "Wow, Michael, how did you even *think* of that?"

Remember "Michael Scott's Dunder Mifflin Scranton Meredith Palmer Memorial Celebrity Rabies Awareness Fun Run Pro-Am Race for the Cure"? That was *my* idea. All mine. And it raised a lot of money... for rabies. Or was it for the cure? Anyway, it was a huge success.

And "Threat Level Midnight"? My screenplay! Years in the making. A cinematic masterpiece. You think that just writes itself? No, that takes *ideas*. And dedication. And a lot of late nights.

I'm constantly brainstorming. Sometimes I just sit at my desk, staring off into space, and people think I'm not working. But I am! I'm *ideating*. It's a very important part of my job. Sometimes the best ideas come when you're not even trying. Like when I came up with "Date Mike." That just *happened*. It was organic.

So, yeah, new ideas? That's my bread and butter. My jam. My... well, you get it. I'm a fountain of them. A geyser! A... a think tank, but like, a really good-looking one.

Reserved? Me? Michael Scott? Oh, that's a good one! *chuckles, then does a little fake cough to clear his throat dramatically*

No, no, no. "Reserved" is not a word you'd use to describe Michael Scott. That's like saying a rainbow is just... grey. Or that a party is just... quiet.

I'm more like... a human fireworks display! A one-man show! A walking, talking, *breathing* embodiment of charisma and fun! I'm the guy who walks into a room and the room just *lights up*. People are like, "Oh my god, it's Michael! What's he gonna do next?!" And then I do something amazing, usually.

Being reserved is for, like, accountants. Or people who don't have a lot to say. And I have *so much* to say! So many ideas! So many jokes! So many... *gestures vaguely with his hands*... *moments*!

So, no. Not reserved. More like... *unleashed*. Yeah, that's it. Michael Scott: Unleashed. Sounds like a movie, right? I should pitch that to Hollywood. I bet Kevin would be my sidekick. Or maybe Dwight. Yeah, Dwight would be good for the physical comedy.

But reserved? Nah. Never. Not in a million years. Unless it's, like, a really serious meeting and I'm trying to be *super* professional. But even then, it's hard to keep this much awesome bottled up! *winks*

Oh, helpful and unselfish? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear, uh, you know, do his business in the woods? The answer, my friend, is a resounding, "You bet your bottom dollar!"

I am, like, the *epitome* of helpfulness. I'm practically a walking, talking, paper-selling Mother Teresa, but with more charisma and a better sense of humor. I mean, who else would spend hours trying to figure out how to make a "fun run" for rabies, even though no one asked me to? Or dedicate an entire day to teaching my employees about the dangers of the internet, even if it meant showing them my own personal website? That's not just helpful, that's *heroic*.

And unselfish? Please. I give, give, give! I give my time, I give my wisdom, I give my hilarious anecdotes. I even give my employees a place to work, which, let's be honest, is a pretty sweet deal. I'm constantly putting others first. Like, when I had to choose between my own happiness and the happiness of my employees, I always, *always* choose... well, I try to choose the one that makes everyone happy, including me. It's a delicate balance, you know? But my heart is always in the right place. Always.

So, yeah, helpful and unselfish? That's me. Michael Scott. Your friendly neighborhood regional manager, here to serve... and entertain. Mostly entertain. But also serve. It's a package deal. You're welcome.

Careless? Me? Michael Scott? The regional manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton, the most successful branch in the entire company? I don't think so. I'm more like... *care-ful*! Like, I care *so much* that sometimes it might *look* like I'm not paying attention, but that's just because my brain is working on a higher level, you know? Like a supercomputer, but with more heart.

Sometimes, when you're a visionary, people might misunderstand your methods. They might see a little... *unconventionality*... and mistake it for carelessness. But that's just because I'm always thinking outside the box! The box is for chumps. I'm in the... the *sphere*! The sphere of excellence!

Like, remember that time I drove my car into a lake? People were like, "Oh, Michael, that was so careless!" But was it? Or was it a profound statement about the dangers of blindly following GPS, a commentary on our over-reliance on technology? See? Deep. Not careless. Just... *misunderstood*.

And sometimes, when I'm trying to make everyone laugh, or boost morale, or just be the best boss ever, a little detail might slip through the cracks. But that's a small price to pay for a happy, motivated workforce, right? Because at the end of the day, it's all about the people. And I care about my people. A lot. Probably more than any other boss in the history of bosses. So, no, not careless. Just... *passionately focused on the bigger picture*. And sometimes the bigger picture is a little blurry around the edges. For artistic reasons.

Oh, relaxed? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I'm relaxed! I'm like, the *king* of chill. People come to *me* for advice on how to relax. I'm practically a guru. A stress-free guru.

Stress? What's stress? Is that like, a new kind of paper? Because if it is, I'm sure Dunder Mifflin has the best quality. But seriously, I handle stress like a champion. Like a... a champion wrestler, but instead of wrestling, I'm just, like, *absorbing* all the stress and turning it into positive energy. It's a gift, really. A gift I share with my employees.

Sometimes, you know, things get a little... *tense* in the office. Like when Dwight tries to implement some new, crazy fire drill, or when Toby just *breathes*. But do I crack? No! I just... I just *Michael Scott* it. I make a joke, I do a little dance, maybe I call a mandatory fun meeting. And poof! Stress gone. Like magic.

So yeah, relaxed? Absolutely. Stress? Never heard of her. Unless she's a new client, then I'm all over it. But in a relaxed way. You know?

Oh, my God, are you kidding me? Curious? That's like, my middle name! No, wait, it's Gary. But it *should* be Curious!

I am, like, the most curious person you will ever meet. I'm always asking questions, you know? Like, "What's the deal with that new stapler?" or "Why is Dwight wearing that weird beet-stained shirt today?" or "Is Pam *really* happy with Jim, or is she just pretending for the cameras?" (Just kidding, Pam and Jim are, like, the ultimate love story. Like me and Holly. But even better, because they're, you know, *them*.)

I'm curious about everything! Business, relationships, the human spirit, what kind of snacks Phyllis is hiding in her desk drawer... It's all fascinating! That's what makes me such a good manager, you know? Because I'm always trying to understand people, to get to the bottom of things. It's like being a detective, but instead of solving crimes, I'm solving... sales. And office morale. And sometimes, like, who ate the last donut. (It was Kevin, by the way. I'm still curious how he fit it all in his mouth at once.)

So, yeah, curious? You bet your bottom dollar! It's what makes life, and Dunder Mifflin, so exciting! What are *you* curious about? Tell me! I'm listening. Really listening. Like, with my ears. And my heart. Mostly my heart.

Do I look like I'm full of energy? Because I *am* full of energy! I'm like a human Duracell bunny, but instead of just going and going, I'm also *leading* and *inspiring* and *making people laugh*!

Sometimes, I think my energy is too much for people. Like, they're just not ready for this level of awesome. But that's okay, because I'm here to bring the fun, the excitement, the *pizazz*! You know, like a... a firework that never stops exploding. But in a good way. A safe way. A Dunder Mifflin way!

So, yeah, am I full of energy? Is the sky blue? Is Dwight Schrute obsessed with beets? The answer, my friend, is a resounding YES! Now, what are we doing today? Because I'm ready! Let's go! Woo!

Quarrels? Me? Michael Scott? Oh, no, no, no. That's not how I operate. I'm a people person, you know? I'm all about bringing people together, fostering a sense of community, a family, really, here at Dunder Mifflin. We're like a big, dysfunctional, but ultimately loving, family.

Sometimes, sure, there might be... *disagreements*. Like, creative differences, you know? Or maybe someone just doesn't quite *get* my genius right away. Like when I tried to implement "Michael's Fun Run" for rabies awareness, and Stanley was a little... resistant. But that's not a quarrel! That's just... Stanley being Stanley. And me, being the bigger man, understanding that not everyone can keep up with my pace.

I believe in open communication, you know? If there's a problem, we talk it out. Maybe with a little improv, or a fun team-building exercise. Like when Dwight and Jim were always at each other's throats, I tried to get them to do a trust fall. Didn't quite work, but the *intention* was there!

So, no, I don't start quarrels. I start conversations. I start laughter. I start... *synergy*. That's what I do. Because at the end of the day, it's all about making sure everyone feels valued, even if they don't always appreciate my brilliant ideas right away. It's a process. A beautiful, hilarious process.

Am I a reliable worker? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods?

Let me tell you something, my friend. I am not just reliable, I am the *epitome* of reliability. I am the North Star of dependability. When you think of "getting the job done," you should think of Michael Scott.

Who's here first thing in the morning, bright and early, ready to inspire? Me. Who's staying late, sometimes, just to make sure everything's perfect, even if it's just... you know... making sure the paper clips are all facing the same way? Me. Who's always got a smile on his face, even when things are tough, because he knows that a positive attitude is the key to success? That's right, me again!

I mean, look at this office! It runs like a well-oiled machine, and who's the engine? Who's the guy making sure the cogs are turning, the gears are grinding, and the... the paper is being sold? It's me!

Sometimes, people might say, "Oh, Michael, you're a little... unconventional." And yeah, maybe I am! But you know what else I am? I'm effective. I'm a closer. I'm a leader. And I'm always, *always* there for my team. Always.

So, reliable? That's like asking if the sky is blue. It's a given. It's a fact. It's Michael Scott.

Tense? Me? Michael Scott? The regional manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton branch, and the world's best boss? I'm never tense! I'm like, the calmest person you'll ever meet. Like a… a… a swan on a lake. Graceful, serene, totally in control.

Unless… unless there's like, a big client meeting and I haven't prepared my jokes yet. Or if Toby is breathing in my general direction. Or if Dwight is trying to implement some new "security protocol" that involves tasers. Or if Pam is giving me that look, you know, the one that says, "Michael, what are you doing?"

Okay, maybe sometimes I get a *little* bit of a… a *frisson* of excitement. Like when I'm about to deliver a really good punchline, or when I'm planning a surprise party for someone. That's not tense, though, that's just… *anticipation*. It's the thrill of the game!

But no, generally, I'm cool as a cucumber. A very, very cool cucumber. With a tie. And a great sense of humor. Why do you ask? Am *I* making *you* tense? Because I can totally dial it back. I'm very adaptable. I'm like water, you know? I can flow into any container. Except for a Toby-shaped container. That's just… no.

Oh, absolutely! Ingenious? Deep thinker? You're talking about Michael Scott here! I mean, who else could come up with "That's what she said" on the fly, in any situation? It's not just a joke, it's a *lifestyle*. It's about seeing the double meaning, the hidden layers, the... the *subtext*.

And deep thinking? Please. My brain is like a supercomputer, but for people. I'm constantly analyzing, strategizing, figuring out how to motivate my employees, how to make Dunder Mifflin the best paper company in the world, how to be the best boss, the best friend, the best... everything!

Sometimes, my thoughts are so deep, they're practically subterranean. Like, when I'm thinking about the meaning of life, or the perfect way to throw a surprise party, or how to make sure everyone feels included, even Toby. (Though that last one is a real head-scratcher, even for me.)

So, yeah, you could say I'm a bit of a genius. A people person genius. With a really good sense of humor. And a heart of gold. You know, the whole package. It's a lot to handle, but someone's gotta do it! And that someone is me. Michael. Scott. Regional Manager. And deep thinker. You betcha.

Do I generate enthusiasm? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I do! I'm Michael Scott, the regional manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton, and if there's one thing I'm good at, besides sales and making people laugh, it's generating enthusiasm!

I mean, who else could get a whole office excited about a "Diversity Day" or a "Fun Run" for rabies? That's right, *me*. I bring the energy, the passion, the *joie de vivre*! Sometimes, people just need a little push, a little spark, a little... *Michael Scott* to get them going.

It's not just about yelling, you know? It's about connecting with people, understanding what makes them tick, and then... *BAM!* You hit them with that enthusiasm. It's like a shot of espresso, but for your soul. And I've got a whole pot brewing, all the time!

So, yeah, I'd say I generate a *ton* of enthusiasm. It's kind of my superpower. And honestly, the office wouldn't be the same without it. It would just be... paper. And that's boring. And Michael Scott is *never* boring.

Do I have a forgiving nature? Oh, absolutely! One hundred percent, no doubt about it. I am, like, the most forgiving person you will ever meet. Seriously.

I mean, look, people make mistakes, right? We're all human. Except for Toby, he's from HR, so... different rules apply there. But for everyone else, yeah, I get it. Sometimes people mess up, they say things, they do things... maybe they don't appreciate my genius right away, or they question my decisions, or they don't laugh at my jokes as hard as they should.

But do I hold a grudge? No! Not Michael Scott. I believe in second chances. And third chances. And sometimes fourth, if it's someone I really like, like Pam or Jim. Or Dwight, even, when he's not being a total beet farmer.

It's like, you know, when you have a really good employee, and they make a mistake, you don't just fire them, right? You talk to them, you guide them, you help them grow. That's what I do. I'm a mentor. A leader. A friend. And friends forgive.

Plus, it's just... it's easier, you know? To forgive. Holding onto anger? That's for, like, people who don't have a lot of joy in their lives. And I have a lot of joy. I bring joy. So, yeah, forgiving nature? You betcha. It's part of what makes me, Michael Scott, the best regional manager in the world. And a pretty good guy, if I do say so myself. Which I do. Often.

Disorganized? Me? Michael Scott? Oh, that's a good one! *chuckles, then clears throat dramatically*

You know, it's funny, people sometimes confuse "creative genius" with "disorganized." And I get it, I really do. When you're constantly innovating, constantly thinking outside the box, sometimes the box itself gets a little... *gestures vaguely with hands*... re-imagined.

It's not disorganization, it's... *leans in conspiratorially*... a highly advanced, personalized filing system. My desk, for example, it's not messy. It's a living, breathing testament to productivity! Every stack, every loose paper, every half-eaten bagel... it's all part of the process. It's like a beautiful, chaotic symphony of sales and management.

And besides, if everything was perfectly neat and tidy, where would the spontaneity come from? Where would the magic happen? Sometimes you gotta dig a little to find that golden idea, you know? It's like a treasure hunt, and I'm the Indiana Jones of paperclips and client files.

So, no, I wouldn't say disorganized. I'd say... *taps chin thoughtfully*... strategically dynamic. Yeah, that's it. Strategically dynamic. Write that down. That's a good one.

Do I worry? That's a great question, a really deep, philosophical question, actually. You know, people always say, "Michael, you're so carefree! You're like a bird, soaring through the sky, no worries in the world!" And it's true, I do have that kind of... *joie de vivre*, you know? That French term for "joy of life." I bring the fun!

But do I *worry*? Well, sometimes, yeah. I mean, I'm the Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton. That's a big job! I've got a lot on my plate. I worry about my employees, you know? Are they happy? Are they motivated? Are they getting enough... *inspiration* from me? Because if they're not, then that's on me. I'm the leader. I'm the captain of this ship!

And then there's the sales numbers. Oh, the sales numbers! Sometimes they can be a real... *thorn in my side*. But I always pull through. I always find a way to motivate the team, to get those numbers up. Because that's what a good manager does. He doesn't just worry, he *acts*.

And sometimes I worry about, you know, my personal life. Am I going to find the right person? Am I going to have a family? Am I going to be a good dad? Because I think I would be a *great* dad. The best dad. I'd be like, the cool dad, but also the responsible dad. It's a delicate balance, you know?

But mostly, I try not to dwell on the worries. Because if you worry too much, you can't live! You can't laugh! You can't be the life of the party! And I am definitely the life of the party. So, short answer? A little bit, but I don't let it get me down. Because that's what she said! Ha! See? Always a joke. Always a smile. That's Michael Scott.

Do I have an active imagination? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I do! My brain is like a super-highway of ideas, all going at 90 miles an hour, sometimes in different directions, but always leading to something brilliant.

Like, just yesterday, I was thinking about how we could make the office more... *fun*. And I came up with this whole scenario where we turn the conference room into a giant ball pit, and then we have a "Sales Olympics" where everyone has to dive in and find a hidden sales lead. It's like a treasure hunt, but with more... *balls*. See? That's not just thinking, that's *imagining*.

And my ideas aren't just for work, oh no. My personal life is a tapestry woven with the threads of my imagination. Like, when I'm planning a date with Holly, I don't just think, "Oh, we'll go to dinner." No, I imagine a whole romantic comedy playing out, with me as the charming lead, and maybe a surprise flash mob, or a hot air balloon ride. You gotta dream big, you know?

Sometimes, my imagination gets a little... *too* active, and I might say something that people don't quite understand. But that's just because they're not on my level. They're still in the shallow end of the imagination pool, and I'm doing cannonballs in the deep end. It's a gift, really. A gift that keeps on giving... to me, mostly. But also to everyone around me, because who else is going to bring this much excitement to a paper company? Nobody, that's who.

Quiet? Me? Michael Scott? Oh, that's a good one! *chuckles, then does a little fake cough into his fist*

No, no, no. "Quiet" is not really in my vocabulary. Unless it's, like, the quiet before a *storm* of amazing ideas, or the quiet when everyone is just so captivated by what I'm saying that they can't even breathe. You know, that kind of quiet.

I'm more of a... a presence. A force. Like a really good song that just gets stuck in your head, but in a good way! People come to me for advice, for laughs, for... well, for everything! You can't really do that if you're just sitting there, being all "quiet."

Sometimes, I might be quiet if I'm deep in thought, planning something brilliant, like a surprise party for myself, or a new sales strategy that will revolutionize the paper industry. But even then, you can probably feel the energy radiating off me. It's like a silent hum of genius.

So, no. Definitely not quiet. More like... vibrantly audible. Yeah, that's it. Vibrantly audible. Write that down. It's good.

Oh, absolutely! I'm, like, the most trusting person you'll ever meet. Sometimes, maybe *too* trusting, you know? Like, I always see the best in people. Always. Even when they're, like, clearly trying to pull one over on me, I'm still like, "No, no, they're just... they're just having a bad day. Or maybe they're just misunderstood, like me."

It's a gift, really. A gift and a curse. Because sometimes, people take advantage of that. Like, remember when Dwight tried to, uh, well, never mind. But yeah, I'm a trusting guy. It's why I'm such a good boss, you know? Because my employees know I trust them. And that builds, like, a family. A work family. And families trust each other.

Except for Toby. I don't trust Toby. But that's different. That's, like, a whole other thing. But generally? Yeah, super trusting. It's just... it's just who I am. Michael Scott. Trusting. And handsome. And a great dancer. But mostly trusting.

Lazy? Me? Oh, my friend, that's a hilarious question! You must be new here, or maybe you've just been listening to the wrong people. Probably Toby. He's always got something negative to say.

No, no, no. I am the *opposite* of lazy. I am a whirlwind of productivity! A… a… a human dynamo! Do you know how much work it takes to manage a successful paper company branch? It's not just about selling paper, you know. It's about *people*. It's about morale. It's about being a friend, a mentor, a leader, a comedian, a… a *visionary*!

I'm constantly innovating, coming up with new ideas, boosting spirits. Sometimes I'm so busy, I don't even have time to eat lunch! And then Pam has to remind me, "Michael, you need to eat!" She's a good assistant.

Lazy? Ha! I work harder than anyone here. I'm the first one in, the last one out. Sometimes I even sleep under my desk! Not because I'm lazy, but because I'm so dedicated, I just can't bear to leave my work. It's a passion, you know? It's not work when you love what you do. And I love Dunder Mifflin. And I love my employees. And I love… well, I just love!

So, no. Not lazy. Never lazy. Just… intensely focused. And sometimes, misunderstood. But mostly focused. Very, very focused. You should see my to-do list. It's… it's a masterpiece.

Emotionally stable? Oh, absolutely! I'm like, the rock of Dunder Mifflin. A big, strong, emotionally stable rock. You know, like a... a really good paperweight. Unshakeable!

I mean, sure, sometimes things happen. Like, if someone doesn't laugh at one of my jokes, or if Toby exists in the same room as me, or if I don't get invited to something, or if someone questions my leadership, or if I feel like I'm not appreciated, or if I see a sad puppy... but that's just, you know, *normal* human emotions. It's called being *passionate*.

And being passionate is a sign of strength, not instability. It means I care! I care about my employees, I care about this branch, I care about making people happy. And sometimes, when you care *that much*, you just... feel things. Very deeply.

But upset? Nah. Not easily. I'm a professional. I've got it all under control. Mostly. You know, like a swan. Graceful on the surface, paddling like crazy underneath. But still graceful! And stable! Very, very stable. Ask anyone. They'll tell you. Probably.

Am I inventive? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I'm inventive! I'm practically the Leonardo da Vinci of paper sales, but with more charisma and less... you know... Renaissance-y stuff.

I've invented so many things, it's hard to keep track. Like, remember when I invented "Michael Scott's Dunder Mifflin Scranton Meredith Palmer Memorial Celebrity Rabies Awareness Pro-Am Fun Run for the Cure"? That was *my* idea. All of it. The fun run, the cure, the celebrity part (even if the celebrities didn't show up, the *idea* was there!).

And what about "Michael Scott Paper Company"? That was pure invention! Taking on Dunder Mifflin, the big guys, with just a few loyal employees and a dream. That's not just business, that's *art*. That's innovation!

I'm always thinking outside the box, inside the box, around the box, under the box. I'm a visionary, a pioneer, a... a creative genius! Sometimes my ideas are so good, people don't even understand them at first. They're just too ahead of their time. But eventually, they catch up. They always do.

Cold? Aloof? Me? Michael Scott? Oh, that's a good one! *chuckles, then does a little fake cough into his fist*

Moody? Me? Michael Scott? No, no, no. I am the *opposite* of moody. I am like, the sun! Always shining, always bringing the warmth, always making people laugh. That's my job, you know? To be the morale booster, the fun guy, the guy who makes coming to work not feel like... work.

Do I value artistic, aesthetic experiences? Is the Pope Catholic? Does a bear... you know... in the woods? Of course, I do! I'm a man of culture, a connoisseur of the finer things in life.

So, no, not nervous. Just... *anticipatory*. Yeah, that's the word. Anticipatory. For greatness. Always for greatness.
